_header: O ye folks that here present be
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Legend of St. George’ — thirty-five stanzas rhyme royal

Bod686.First Lines:
S ye folkes þat here present beWhich of þis story shal
                    haue inspeccoun…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Was brennt vnwarly by consumpsiounAs he repeired home to his
                    mansioun
Bod686.Note:
The illuminated gold initial is indeed ‘S’, probably a
                    mistake.
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here endeth þe life of seynte Margarete. And begynneth þe lyfe of
                    the glorious martir seint George (f. 200v); Here endeth the lyfe of
                    seynt George. And here begynneth þe prologe of þe xv Ioyes of our
                    ladye (at the end)
Bod686.Editions:
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             “Two Tapestry Poems by Lydgate: the Life of St. George and the Falls of
                Seven Princes.” 
             Englische Studie
         43 (1910-11): 10-26: 13-21.

CamTCC600.First Lines:
O yee folk þat heer present beWheeche of þis story shal
                    haue InspeccionOf saint George yee may beholde and seeHis martirdome
                    and his passyoun…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Was brent vnwarly by consumpcyonAs he repayred hoome to his
                    mansyoun
CamTCC600.Attributed Author: daun Iohan þe Munk of Bury Lydegate (p. 74)
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Nexst nowe filowing here bygynneþe þe devyse of a steyned halle
                    of þe lyf of saint George ymagyned by daun Iohan þe Munk of Bury
                    Lydegate and made with þe balade at þe request of þarmorieres of
                    london for þonour of þeyre broþerhoode and þeyre feest of
                    saint George þee poete first declareþe (p. 74); A Storye of Saint
                    George (RT)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 1.145-54.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
[o] yE folke all whyche here in presence beWhyche of thys history
                    shull haue inspeccionOf seynt George ye may beholde & seeAnd howe
                    he ys oure protectour and patron…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Was brent meruelously by a consumpciouneAs he repayryd hem to
                    hys mansyoune
CamTCC601.Attributed Title:
The lyfe of saynt gorge compyled by Iohn ludgate monke of bery at þe
                    request of þe armerers of london to peynt about ther haulle (added by later
                    hand, top margin f. 315); explicit vita sancti Georgii Martiris (f.
                        317v)
CamTCC601.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 1.145-54.

Chetham6709.First Lines:
O ye ffolkys that here present beWhich of this story shall have
                    InspeccyonOff seynt George ye may beholde & seeHis martyrdom and
                    his passyon…
Chetham6709.Last Lines:
…Was brent vnwarely be consumpsyounAs he repayred home to his
                    Mansyoun
